description: The BIS core schema contains classes that all other domain schemas extend.

AnnotationElement2d.description: bis:AnnotationElement2d is a bis:GraphicalElement2d used to annotate drawings and sheets.
AnnotationElement2d.label: 2D Annotation Element

properties.description: Description of the style
properties.name: Description

properties.description: Encoded style properties
properties.name: Data

properties.description: Description of the style
properties.name: Description

properties.description: Encoded style properties
properties.name: Data

properties.description: Description of the style
properties.name: Description

properties.description: Encoded style properties
properties.name: Data

AutoHandledProperty.description: Applied to an element's property to indicate that select, update, and insert of the property's value are handled automatically by the platform.

properties.description: Indicates the statement types that are relevant for a particular auto-handled property.
properties.name: StatementTypes

properties.description: See the ACSType enum. None = 0;  Rectangular = 1; Cylindrical = 2; Spherical = 3.
properties.name: Type

properties.description: A human-readable description of the Auxiliary Coordinate System
properties.name: Description

properties.description: Defines the real location of the 0, 0 coordinate of the ACS.
properties.name: Origin

properties.description: The angle (in degrees) of the Coordinate System
properties.name: Angle

properties.description: Defines the plane of the ACS and the real location of the 0, 0, 0 coordinate of the ACS.
properties.name: Origin

properties.description: The Yaw angle (in degrees) of the orientation of this Coordinate System
properties.name: Yaw

properties.description: The Pitch angle (in degrees) of the orientation of this Coordinate System
properties.name: Pitch

properties.description: The Roll angle (in degrees) of the orientation of this Coordinate System
properties.name: Roll

Category.description: A bis:Category categorizes a bis:GeometricElement and its geometry. Every bis:GeometricElement is in one and only one bis:Category. The visibility (on/off) of a bis:Category may be controlled per-view. Categories are similar to levels in DGN, layers in DWG, and categories in RVT.

properties.description: A human-readable description of the Category
properties.label: Description
properties.name: Description

properties.description: The Rank of a category indicates how it was created and where it can be used. 0=System; 1=Domain; 2=Application; 3=User.
properties.name: Rank

ClassHasHandler.description: Applied to an ECClass to indicate that a C++ subclass of DgnDomain::Handler will supply behavior for it at run-time. This custom attribute may only be used by BisCore or other core schemas.

properties.description: List of actions that are not permitted when the associated handler is not available
properties.name: Restrictions

CodeSpec.description: A bis:CodeSpec (code specification) captures the rules for encoding and decoding significant business information into and from a Code (string). This specification is used to generate and validate Codes.
CodeSpec.label: Code Specification

properties.description: The unique name of the bis:CodeSpec. A best practice is to incorporate the schema alias or domain name into the bis:CodeSpec name to ensure uniqueness.
properties.name: Name

properties.description: A JSON string containing scope and fragment specifications used to generate and validate code values
properties.name: JsonProperties

properties.description: A human-readable description of the ColorBook
properties.name: Description

CustomHandledProperty.description: Applied to an element's property to indicate that the property's value is handled specially by a C++ class. Can only be applied to properties of ECClasses that specify ClassHasHandler.

properties.description: Indicates the statement types that are relevant for a particular custom-handled property.
properties.name: StatementTypes

CustomHandledPropertyStatementType.description: Restrictions that may be applied to a CustomHandledProperty. Must match the ECSqlClassParams::StatementType enum

DefinitionElement.description: A bis:DefinitionElement holds configuration-related information that is meant to be referenced/shared.
DefinitionElement.label: Definition Element

properties.description: If true, this bis:DefinitionElement should not be displayed in the GUI.
properties.label: Is Private
properties.name: IsPrivate

DefinitionModel.description: A container for persisting bis:DefinitionElement instances.
DefinitionModel.label: Definition Model

DefinitionPartition.description: A bis:DefinitionPartition element establishes a 'Definition' Modeling Perspective for its parent bis:Subject. A bis:DefinitionPartition is always sub-modeled by a bis:DefinitionModel.
DefinitionPartition.label: Definition Partition

DictionaryModel.description: The singleton container for repository-global bis:DefinitionElement instances.
DictionaryModel.label: Dictionary Model

DisplayStyle.description: A bis:DisplayStyle defines the 'styling' parameters for rendering the contents of a view. It determines how graphics are rendered, not which elements are rendered. A bis:DisplayStyle can be shared by many Views.
DisplayStyle.label: Display Style

DisplayStyle2d.description: A bis:DisplayStyle2d defines the 'styling' parameters for rendering the contents of a 2D View.
DisplayStyle2d.label: 2D Display Style

DisplayStyle3d.description: A bis:DisplayStyle3d defines the 'styling' parameters for rendering the contents of a 3D View.
DisplayStyle3d.label: 3D Display Style

Document.description: A bis:Document is a social artifact designed with the distinct purpose to convey information in a manner that maximizes reach and lifespan and minimize dependency on other artifacts. Although there is often a one-to-one relationship between a bis:Document and an electronic file, this does not imply that a document is a file; instead, a document can be realized in many different media (such as paper) or have more than one file supporting it.
Document.label: Document

customAttributes.Description: BisCore will focus on the information itself and not how it is carried. Thus, the DocumentCarrier class was deprecated.

DocumentCarrier.description: DEPRECATED: A Document Carrier is an Information Carrier that carries a Document. An electronic file is a good example.
DocumentCarrier.label: Document Carrier

DocumentListModel.description: A container for persisting bis:Document elements.
DocumentListModel.label: Document List

DocumentPartition.description: A bis:DocumentPartition element establishes a 'Document' Modeling Perspective for its parent bis:Subject. A bis:DocumentPartition is always sub-modeled by a bis:DocumentListModel.
DocumentPartition.label: Document Partition

Drawing.description: A bis:Drawing is a bis:Document of a 2D drawing.

DrawingCategory.description: A bis:DrawingCategory is used for classifying bis:GeometricElement2d elements via the bis:GeometricElement2dIsInCategory (concrete and sealed) relationship.
DrawingCategory.label: Drawing Category

DrawingGraphic.description: bis:DrawingGraphic is a bis:GraphicalElement2d used to persist graphics for use in drawings.
DrawingGraphic.label: Drawing Graphic

DrawingGraphicRepresentsElement.description: Relates a bis:DrawingGraphic to the bis:Element that it represents.

DrawingModel.description: A container for persisting bis:DrawingGraphic elements.
DrawingModel.label: Drawing Model

DrawingViewDefinition.description: A bis:DrawingViewDefinition specifies parameters for a view of a bis:DrawingModel.
DrawingViewDefinition.label: Drawing View Definition

DriverBundleElement.description: A bis:DriverBundleElement is used in conjunction with bis:ElementDrivesElement relationships to bundle multiple inputs before driving the output bis:Element.
DriverBundleElement.label: Driver Bundle Element

Element.description: A bis:Element is the smallest individually identifiable building block for modeling the real world. Each bis:Element represents an Entity in the real world. Sets of bis:Elements (contained in bis:Models) are used to sub-model other bis:Elements that represent larger scale real world Entities. Using this recursive modeling strategy, bis:Elements can represent Entities at any scale. Elements can represent physical things, abstract concepts or simply be information records.

properties.description: The bis:Model that contains this bis:Element.
properties.name: Model

properties.description: The last modified time of the bis:Element. This is maintained by the core framework and should not be set directly by applications.
properties.label: Last Modified
properties.name: LastMod

properties.description: The CodeSpec property identifies the bis:CodeSpec used to generate and validate the code for this bis:Element. The combination of CodeSpec, CodeScope, and CodeValue properties must be unique for each bis:Element instance.
properties.label: Code Specification
properties.name: CodeSpec

properties.description: The CodeScope property identifies the bis:Element that provides the uniqueness scope for the code value. The combination of CodeSpec, CodeScope, and CodeValue properties must be unique for each bis:Element instance.
properties.label: Code Scope
properties.name: CodeScope

properties.description: The CodeValue property stores the formal name (business key) for a bis:Element. The combination of CodeSpec, CodeScope, and CodeValue properties must be unique for each bis:Element instance.
properties.label: Code
properties.name: CodeValue

properties.description: An optional friendly name given by the user (as opposed to the formal name stored in the CodeValue property).
properties.label: User Label
properties.name: UserLabel

properties.description: The parent bis:Element that owns this bis:Element.
properties.name: Parent

properties.description: The GUID used to federate this bis:Element across repositories.
properties.label: Federation GUID
properties.name: FederationGuid

properties.description: A string property that users and/or applications can use to persist ad hoc JSON values.
properties.label: JSON Properties
properties.name: JsonProperties

ElementAspect.description: A bis:ElementAspect is a class that defines a set of properties that are related to (and owned by) a single bis:Element. Semantically, a bis:ElementAspect can be considered part of the bis:Element. Thus, a bis:ElementAspect is deleted if its owning bis:Element is deleted.
ElementAspect.label: Element Aspect

ElementDrivesElement.description: A relationship that indicates that the source Element drives (controls the lifecycle or structure of) a dependent target Element.

properties.description: Bits that indicate the status of the dependency. Satisfied=0, Failed=1, Deferred=128. Deferred and Failed bits can be OR-ed together.
properties.name: Status

properties.description: The priority of this dependency, relative to other ElementDrivesElement instances. Note that ElementOwnsChildElements dependencies always take priority over ElementDrivesElement dependencies.
properties.name: Priority

ElementEncapsulatesElements.description: A relationship that indicates that child bis:Elements are meant to be hidden.

ElementGroupsMembers.description: A generic relationship used to capture the members of a defined set of bis:Elements.

properties.description: Can be used to prioritize or order members within an ElementGroup. Values do not have to be unique within a particular group.
properties.label: Member Priority
properties.name: MemberPriority

ElementMultiAspect.description: A bis:ElementMultiAspect is a bis:ElementAspect where there can be N instances of the bis:ElementAspect class per bis:Element.
ElementMultiAspect.label: Element Multi-Aspect

properties.description: The bis:Element that owns this bis:ElementMultiAspect.
properties.name: Element

ElementOwnsChildElements.description: Relates a bis:Element to child bis:Elements which represent parts of the Entity modeled by the parent bis:Element.

ElementRefersToDocuments.description: A general relationship between a bis:Element and a bis:Document. There is no implied owner in this relationship  so it is valid for relationship where the document existed before the referenced element (e.g. design specification) or after (e.g. operational results).

ElementRefersToElements.description: A general relationship between two bis:Elements. These are typically specialized by derived relationship to give more specific meaning.

ElementUniqueAspect.description: A bis:ElementUniqueAspect is a bis:ElementAspect where there can be only zero or one instance of the bis:ElementAspect class per bis:Element.
ElementUniqueAspect.label: Element Unique Aspect

properties.description: The bis:Element that owns this bis:ElementUniqueAspect
properties.name: Element

EmbeddedFileLink.description: A bis:EmbeddedFileLink is a bis:LinkElement that links to a file embedded within the iModel.
EmbeddedFileLink.label: Embedded File Link

properties.description: A name for looking up the embedded file. Must be unique within the iModel.
properties.name: Name

properties.description: A human-readable description of the Embedded File
properties.name: Description

ExternalSourceAspect.description: A bis:ElementMultiAspect that stores synchronization information for a bis:Element originating from an external source.
ExternalSourceAspect.label: External Source Aspect

properties.description: The context in which the combination of (Kind, Identifier) identifies the object uniquely within the source repository. Scope is the Id of a bis:Element in the iModel (not the source) that corresponds to the scope or container in the source that owns, contains, or qualifies the idEntity of the source object.
properties.label: Scope
properties.name: Scope

properties.description: The identifier of the object in the source repository
properties.name: Identifier

properties.description: The kind of object within the source repository
properties.name: Kind

properties.description: An optional value that is typically a version number or a pseudo version number like last modified time. It will be used by the synchronization process to detect that a source object is unchanged so that computing a cryptographic hash can be avoided. If present, this value must be guaranteed to change when any of the source object's content changes.
properties.name: Version

properties.description: The cryptographic hash (any algorithm) of the source object's content. If defined, it must be guaranteed to change when the source object's content changes.
properties.name: Checksum

properties.description: A place where additional JSON properties can be stored. For example, provenance information or properties relating to the synchronization process.
properties.name: JsonProperties

GeometricElement.description: bis:GeometricElement ia an abstract base class used to model real world Entities that intrinsically have geometry.
GeometricElement.label: Geometric Element

GeometricElement2d.description: bis:GeometricElement2d is an abstract base class used to model information Entities that intrinsically have 2D geometry.
GeometricElement2d.label: 2D Geometric Element

properties.description: The bis:DrawingCategory used to categorize this bis:GeometricElement2d instance.
properties.name: Category

properties.description: The placement origin of this bis:Element.
properties.name: Origin

properties.description: The placement rotation (in degrees) of this bis:Element.
properties.name: Rotation

properties.description: The 'low' point of the element-aligned bounding box of this bis:Element.
properties.label: Bounding Box Low
properties.name: BBoxLow

properties.description: The 'high' point of the element-aligned bounding box of this bis:Element.
properties.label: Bounding Box High
properties.name: BBoxHigh

properties.description: Binary stream used to persist the geometry of this bis:Element.
properties.label: Geometry Stream
properties.name: GeometryStream

properties.description: Points to an instance of some specialization of TypeDefinition, which holds property values that vary per-type rather than by instance of this Element.
properties.label: Type Definition
properties.name: TypeDefinition

GeometricElement2dIsInCategory.description: The relationship that determines the bis:DrawingCategory for a bis:GeometricElement2d.

GeometricElement3d.description: bis:GeometricElement3d is an abstract base class used to model real world Entities that intrinsically have 3D geometry.
GeometricElement3d.label: 3D Geometric Element

properties.description: The bis:SpatialCategory used to categorize this bis:GeometricElement3d
properties.name: Category

properties.description: If true, this element will have an entry in the Spatial Index.
properties.label: In Spatial Index
properties.name: InSpatialIndex

properties.description: The placement origin of this bis:Element.
properties.name: Origin

properties.description: The Yaw angle (in degrees) of the orientation of this bis:Element.
properties.name: Yaw

properties.description: The Pitch angle (in degrees) of the orientation of this bis:Element.
properties.name: Pitch

properties.description: The Roll angle (in degrees) of the orientation of this bis:Element.
properties.name: Roll

properties.description: The 'low' point of the element-aligned bounding box of this bis:Element.
properties.label: Bounding Box Low
properties.name: BBoxLow

properties.description: The 'high' point of the element-aligned bounding box of this bis:Element.
properties.label: Bounding Box High
properties.name: BBoxHigh

properties.description: Binary stream used to persist the geometry of this bis:Element.
properties.label: Geometry Stream
properties.name: GeometryStream

properties.description: Points to an instance of some specialization of TypeDefinition, which holds property values that vary per-type rather than per-instance of this Element.
properties.label: Type Definition
properties.name: TypeDefinition

GeometricElement3dIsInCategory.description: The relationship that determines the bis:SpatialCategory for a bis:GeometricElement3d.

GeometricModel.description: A container for persisting bis:GeometricElement instances.
GeometricModel.label: Geometric Model

properties.description: A GUID that changes whenever any element in this GeometricModel has a change to its geometry.
properties.label: Geometry GUID
properties.name: GeometryGuid

GeometricModel2d.description: A container for persisting bis:GeometricElement2d instances.
GeometricModel2d.label: 2D Geometric Model

properties.description: The actual coordinates of (0,0) in modeling coordinates. An offset applied to all modeling coordinates.
properties.label: Global Origin
properties.name: GlobalOrigin

GeometricModel3d.description: A container for persisting bis:GeometricElement3d instances, which are considered to be in the iModel's real-world coordinate system unless their InSpatialIndex property has been set to 'false'.
GeometricModel3d.label: 3D Geometric Model

properties.description: If IsNotSpatiallyLocated is true, then the elements in this bis:GeometricModel3d are not in real-world coordinates and will not be in the spatial index.
properties.label: Is Not Spatially Located
properties.name: IsNotSpatiallyLocated

properties.description: If IsPlanProjection is true, then the elements in this bis:GeometricModel3d are expected to be in an XY plane.
properties.label: Is Plan Projection
properties.name: IsPlanProjection

GeometryPart.description: A bis:DefinitionElement that specifies a collection of geometry that is meant to be reused across bis:GeometricElement instances. Leveraging bis:GeometryParts can help reduce file size and improve display performance.
GeometryPart.label: Geometry Part

properties.description: The actual geometry of the Geometry Part
properties.label: Geometry Stream
properties.name: GeometryStream

properties.description: The low corner of the Geometry Part's bounding box.
properties.label: Bounding Box Low
properties.name: BBoxLow

properties.description: The high corner of the Geometry Part's bounding box
properties.label: Bounding Box High
properties.name: BBoxHigh

GraphicalElement2d.description: bis:GraphicalElement2d is an abstract base class for 2D geometric elements that are used to convey information within graphical presentations (like drawings).
GraphicalElement2d.label: 2D Graphical Element

GraphicalElement3d.description: A bis:GraphicalElement3d element conveys information within 3D graphical presentations.
GraphicalElement3d.label: 3D Graphical Element

GraphicalElement3dRepresentsElement.description: Relates a bis:GraphicalElement3d to the bis:Element that it represents.

GraphicalModel2d.description: A container for persisting bis:GraphicalElement2d instances.
GraphicalModel2d.label: 2D Graphical Model

GraphicalModel3d.description: A container for persisting bis:GraphicalElement3d instances.
GraphicalModel3d.label: 3D Graphical Model

GraphicalPartition3d.description: A bis:GraphicalPartition3d element establishes a '3D Graphical' Modeling Perspective for its parent bis:Subject. A bis:GraphicalPartition3d is always sub-modeled by a bis:GraphicalModel3d.
GraphicalPartition3d.label: 3D Graphical Partition

GraphicalType2d.description: Defines a shared set of properties (the 'type') that can be associated with a bis:GraphicalElement2d instance.
GraphicalType2d.label: 2D Graphical Type

GroupInformationElement.description: bis:GroupInformationElement is an abstract base class used for modeling Entities whose main purpose is to group related elements.
GroupInformationElement.label: Group Information

GroupInformationModel.description: A container for persisting bis:GroupInformationElement instances.
GroupInformationModel.label: Group Information Model

GroupInformationPartition.description: A bis:GroupInformationPartition element establishes a 'Group Information' Modeling Perspective for its parent bis:Subject. A bis:GroupInformationPartition is always sub-modeled by a bis:GroupInformationModel.
GroupInformationPartition.label: Group Information Partition

IParentElement.description: An interface that can be mixed-into a bis:Element to indicate that it can be a parent (own child Elements). This interface is mutually exclusive with bis:ISubModeledElement.
IParentElement.label: Parent Element

ISubModeledElement.description: An interface that can be mixed-into a bis:Element to indicate that it can be sub-modeled by a finer-grained bis:Model. This interface is mutually exclusive with bis:IParentElement.
ISubModeledElement.label: Sub-Modeled Element

customAttributes.Description: BisCore will focus on the information itself and not how it is carried. Thus, the InformationCarrierElement class was deprecated.

InformationCarrierElement.description: DEPRECATED: An Information Carrier carries information, but is not the information itself. For example, the arrangement of ink on paper or the sequence of electronic bits are information carriers.
InformationCarrierElement.label: Information Carrier

InformationContentElement.description: bis:InformationContentElement is an abstract base class for modeling pure information Entities. Only the core framework should directly subclass from bis:InformationContentElement. Domain and application developers should start with the most appropriate subclass of bis:InformationContentElement.
InformationContentElement.label: Information Content Element

InformationModel.description: A container for persisting bis:InformationContentElement instances.
InformationModel.label: Information Model

InformationPartitionElement.description: An instance of a specialization of bis:InformationPartitionElement establishes a particular Modeling Perspective for its parent bis:Subject. Instances are always sub-modeled by a specialization of bis:Model of the appropriate Modeling Perspective.
InformationPartitionElement.label: Information Partition

properties.description: A human-readable string describing the intent behind the partition.
properties.name: Description

InformationRecordElement.description: bis:InformationRecordElement is an abstract base class for modeling information records. The bis:InformationRecordElement class is the default choice if no other subclass of bis:InformationContentElement makes sense.
InformationRecordElement.label: Information Record Element

InformationRecordModel.description: A container for persisting bis:InformationRecordElement instances
InformationRecordModel.label: Information Record Model

InformationRecordPartition.description: A bis:InformationRecordPartition element establishes a 'Information Record' Modeling Perspective for its parent bis:Subject. A bis:InformationRecordPartition is always sub-modeled by a bis:InformationRecordModel.
InformationRecordPartition.label: Information Record Partition

InformationReferenceElement.description: bis:InformationReferenceElement is an abstract base class used for modeling Entities whose main purpose is to reference something else.
InformationReferenceElement.label: Information Reference

LightLocation.description: The spatial location of a light source
LightLocation.label: Light Location

properties.description: Indicates that the light is on.
properties.label: Is light turned on
properties.name: Enabled

properties.description: Description of the style
properties.name: Description

properties.description: Encoded style properties
properties.name: Data

LinkElement.description: A bis:LinkElement is a bis:InformationReferenceElement that specifies a link to some resource that is not modeled with BIS.
LinkElement.label: Link

LinkModel.description: A container for persisting bis:LinkElement instances.
LinkModel.label: Link Model

LinkPartition.description: A bis:LinkPartition element establishes a 'Link' Modeling Perspective for its parent bis:Subject. A bis:LinkPartition is always sub-modeled by a bis:LinkModel.
LinkPartition.label: Link Partition

Model.description: A bis:Model is a container for persisting a collection of related elements.

properties.description: The parent bis:Model contains the bis:Element that this bis:Model is sub-modeling.
properties.label: Parent Model
properties.name: ParentModel

properties.description: The bis:Element that this bis:Model is sub-modeling. This bis:Model models the same Entity as the sub-Modeled bis:Element, but at a finer granularity.
properties.label: Modeled Element
properties.name: ModeledElement

properties.description: If IsPrivate is true then this bis:Model should not appear in lists shown to the user.
properties.label: Is Private
properties.name: IsPrivate

properties.description: If IsTemplate is true then this bis:Model is used as a template for creating new instances.
properties.label: Is Template
properties.name: IsTemplate

properties.description: A string property that users and/or applications can use to persist ad hoc JSON values.
properties.label: JSON Properties
properties.name: JsonProperties

properties.description: The last time any element in this Model was modified.
properties.label: Last Modified
properties.name: LastMod

ModelContainsElements.description: The relationship that enforces that each bis:Element belongs to exactly one bis:Model.

ModelModelsElement.description: Relates a bis:Model to the bis:Element that it sub-models. The sub-Model models the same Entity as the sub-modeled Element, but at a finer granularity.
ModelModelsElement.label: Model Sub-Models Element

ModelOwnsSubModel.description: This relationship is essentially redundant with the combination of bis:ModelModelsElement and bis:ModelContainsElements. This 'shortcut' exists to support a model hierarchy index for performance reasons.

OrthographicViewDefinition.description: A spatial view that always shows a parallel projection.
OrthographicViewDefinition.label: Orthographic Spatial View

PhysicalElement.description: A bis:PhysicalElement is spatially located, has mass, and can be 'touched'.
PhysicalElement.label: Physical Element

PhysicalElementAssemblesElements.description: A relationship that indicates a physical assembly of child bis:PhysicalElements.

PhysicalElementIsOfType.description: A type-instance relation; one that indicates that the specific bis:PhysicalElement is an instance of the defined bis:PhysicalType. E.g. a pump with serial number #AR-23 is of type X-Model-Y.

PhysicalMaterial.description: A bis:PhysicalMaterial defines the matter of which physical objects are made. bis:PhysicalMaterials are not used to define rendering characteristics (see bis:RenderMaterial).
PhysicalMaterial.label: Physical Material

PhysicalModel.description: A container for persisting bis:PhysicalElement and bis:SpatialLocationElement instances used to model real physical space. Also allows bis:GraphicalElement3d and bis:InformationContentElement.
PhysicalModel.label: Physical Model

customAttributes.Description: The PhysicalPortion class has been deprecated, so this relationship class is also deprecated.

PhysicalPartition.description: A bis:PhysicalPartition element establishes a 'Physical' Modeling Perspective for its parent bis:Subject. A bis:PhysicalPartition is always sub-modeled by a bis:PhysicalModel.
PhysicalPartition.label: Physical Partition

customAttributes.Description: The best practice is now to inherit from a PhysicalElement subclass and mix-in ISubModeledElement directly.

PhysicalPortion.description: DEPRECATED: A Physical Portion represents an arbitrary portion of a larger Physical Element that will be sub-modeled by a Physical Model.
PhysicalPortion.label: Physical Portion

PhysicalType.description: Defines a shared set of properties whose values vary per-type of a bis:PhysicalElement rather than per-instance. Intended for modeling Entities such as catalog entries, that typically define property values that are common among all instances associated with a given catalog entry.
PhysicalType.label: Physical Type

RecipeDefinitionElement.description: Defines instructions for creating/updating Element instances, e.g. determining their geometry from a template or a parametric script.
RecipeDefinitionElement.label: Recipe Definition

RenderMaterial.description: A bis:RenderMaterial defines the rendering properties of materials for display. Not to be confused with a bis:PhysicalMaterial.
RenderMaterial.label: Render Material

properties.description: The palette name that categorizes this RenderMaterial.
properties.name: PaletteName

properties.description: A human-readable description of the RenderMaterial
properties.name: Description

RepositoryLink.description: A bis:RepositoryLink is a bis:UrlLink element that links to an external repository. It implements ISubModeledElement only so that a sub-Model could be used to cache information from the external repository.
RepositoryLink.label: Repository Link

properties.description: A GUID that identifies the external repository.
properties.label: Repository GUID
properties.name: RepositoryGuid

RepositoryModel.description: The singleton Model at the root of a BIS repository. Contains a hierarchy of bis:Subject elements that declare what the repository is modeling and child bis:InformationPartitionElement instances that establish Modeling Perspectives. Serves as a high-level table-of-contents for the BIS repository.
RepositoryModel.label: Repository Model

ReservedPropertyNames.description: Declare a list of properties as reserved. The property name listed would be forbidden from use in the class and classes that inherit from it.

properties.description: An array of names of properties that should not be used. Case-insensitive comparison will be used.
properties.name: PropertyNames

RoleElement.description: A real world Entity is modeled as a bis:RoleElement when a set of external circumstances define an important role (one that is worth tracking) that is not intrinsic to the Entity playing the role. For example, a person can play the role of a teacher or a rock can play the role of a boundary marker.
RoleElement.label: Role Element

RoleModel.description: A container for persisting bis:RoleElement instances.
RoleModel.label: Role Model

SchemaHasBehavior.description: Applied to an ECSchema to indicate that there is an associated JavaScript library that will provide run-time behavior.

properties.description: List of actions that are not permitted when the associated JavaScript library is not available.
properties.name: Restrictions

SectionDrawing.description: A bis:SectionDrawing is a bis:Document of a 2D section drawing.
SectionDrawing.label: Section Drawing

SectionDrawingModel.description: A container for persisting section bis:DrawingGraphic elements representing a cross-section of a PhysicalModel. Generally at the same scale as the sectioned geometry to allow it to be display in situ at the location of the sectioning.
SectionDrawingModel.label: Section Drawing Model

SectionLocation.description: The section location defines how a section drawing should be generated in a 3d view.
SectionLocation.label: Section Location

properties.description: Type of the section: e.g. Section, Plan, Elevation, Detail.
properties.label: Section Type
properties.name: SectionType

properties.description: Details on how this section was clipped.
properties.label: Clip Geometry
properties.name: ClipGeometry

properties.description: Describes the models relevant for this section location display.
properties.label: Model Selector
properties.name: ModelSelector

properties.description: Describes the categories relevant for this section location display.
properties.label: Category Selector
properties.name: CategorySelector

properties.label: Describes the view attachment attached to this section location
properties.name: ViewAttachment

SectionLocationUsesCategorySelector.description: Relates a section location to the categories relevant for this section location display.

SectionLocationUsesModelSelector.description: Relates a section location to the models relevant for this section location display.

Sheet.description: A bis:Sheet is a bis:Document of a 2D sheet.

properties.description: The Sheet's drawing scale
properties.name: Scale

properties.description: Height of the Sheet (in meters)
properties.name: Height

properties.description: Width of the Sheet (in meters)
properties.name: Width

properties.description: Height of the sheet border.
properties.name: Height

properties.description: Width of the sheet border.
properties.name: Width

SheetModel.description: A container for persisting sheet views and graphics.
SheetModel.label: Sheet Model

properties.description: Height of the sheet.
properties.name: Height

properties.description: Width of the sheet.
properties.name: Width

SheetViewDefinition.description: A bis:SheetViewDefinition specifies parameters for a view of a bis:SheetModel.
SheetViewDefinition.label: Sheet View Definition

SpatialCategory.description: A bis:SpatialCategory is used for classifying bis:GeometricElement3d elements via the bis:GeometricElement3dIsInCategory (concrete and sealed) relationship.
SpatialCategory.label: Spatial Category

SpatialElement.description: A bis:SpatialElement is a bis:GeometricElement3d that occupies real world space.
SpatialElement.label: Spatial Element

SpatialIndex.description: The Spatial Index contains information used to optimize spatial queries. Like other database indices, it is automatically maintained by the system.
SpatialIndex.label: Spatial Index

properties.description: Minimum X value of the axis-aligned range box that encloses the spatial element
properties.label: Min X
properties.name: MinX

properties.description: Maximum X value of the axis-aligned range box that encloses the spatial element
properties.label: Max X
properties.name: MaxX

properties.description: Minimum Y value of the axis-aligned range box that encloses the spatial element
properties.label: Min Y
properties.name: MinY

properties.description: Maximum Y value of the axis-aligned range box that encloses the spatial element
properties.label: Max Y
properties.name: MaxY

properties.description: Minimum Z value of the axis-aligned range box that encloses the spatial element
properties.label: Min Z
properties.name: MinZ

properties.description: Maximum Z value of the axis-aligned range box that encloses the spatial element
properties.label: Max Z
properties.name: MaxZ

SpatialLocationElement.description: A bis:SpatialLocationElement identifies a 'tracked' real world location but has no mass and cannot be 'touched'.
SpatialLocationElement.label: Spatial Location Element

SpatialLocationIsOfType.description: A type-instance relation; one that indicates that the specific bis:SpatialLocationElement is an instance of the defined bis:SpatialLocationType. E.g. AssemblyArea#5 if of type FloorSpace.

SpatialLocationModel.description: A container for persisting bis:SpatialLocationElement instances. Also allows bis:GraphicalElement3d and bis:InformationContentElement.
SpatialLocationModel.label: Spatial Location Model

SpatialLocationPartition.description: A bis:SpatialLocationPartition element establishes a 'SpatialLocation' Modeling Perspective for its parent bis:Subject. A bis:SpatialLocationPartition is always sub-modeled by a bis:SpatialLocationModel.
SpatialLocationPartition.label: Spatial Location Partition

customAttributes.Description: The best practice is now to inherit from a SpatialLocationElement subclass and mix-in ISubModeledElement directly.

SpatialLocationPortion.description: DEPRECATED: A Spatial Location Portion represents an arbitrary portion of a larger Spatial Location Element that will be sub-modeled by a Spatial Location Model.
SpatialLocationPortion.label: Spatial Location Portion

SpatialLocationType.description: Defines a shared set of properties whose values vary per-type of a bis:SpatialLocationElement rather than per-instance.
SpatialLocationType.label: Spatial Location Type

SpatialModel.description: An abstract base class for bis:PhysicalModel and bis:SpatialLocationModel--the only two types of model for real physical space. Other GeometricModel3d specializations use the real-world coordinate system, but are considered as informational or mathematical abstractions.
SpatialModel.label: Spatial Model

SpatialViewDefinition.description: A view of a spatially located volume.
SpatialViewDefinition.label: Spatial View Definition

SubCategory.description: A bis:SubCategory is a subdivision of a bis:Category. SubCategories allow GeometricElements to have multiple pieces of Geometry that can be independently visible and styled (color, linesStyle, transparency, etc.). It is important to understand that a bis:SubCategory is not a bis:Category (i.e. Categories do not nest). bis:GeometricElements are always related to a bis:Category, not a bis:SubCategory.
SubCategory.label: Sub-Category

properties.description: A human-readable description of the SubCategory
properties.name: Description

properties.description: Contains the display properties (color, style, weight, etc.) for the SubCategory. It should not be used for the persistence of application-specific information.
properties.name: Properties

Subject.description: A bis:Subject is an information element that references (by name) some real-world Object that will be modeled in this BIS repository.

properties.description: A human-readable description of the real-world Object(s) that will be modeled for this Subject
properties.name: Description

TemplateRecipe2d.description: A recipe that uses a 2D template for creating new instances.
TemplateRecipe2d.label: 2D Template Recipe

TemplateRecipe3d.description: A recipe that uses a 3D template for creating new instances.
TemplateRecipe3d.label: 3D Template Recipe

TemplateViewDefinition2d.description: A bis:ViewDefinition2d used to display a 2D template model.
TemplateViewDefinition2d.label: 2D Template View Definition

TemplateViewDefinition3d.description: A bis:ViewDefinition3d used to display a 3D template model.
TemplateViewDefinition3d.label: 3D Template View Definition

TextAnnotationData.description: The aspect used to store text annotation data for bis:TextAnnotation2d an bis:TextAnnotation3d elements.
TextAnnotationData.label: Text Annotation Data

properties.description: Text in Annotations.fb.h flat buffer format
properties.label: Text Annotation
properties.name: TextAnnotation

properties.description: Description of the style
properties.name: Description

properties.description: Encoded style properties
properties.name: Data

Texture.description: A bis:Texture represents a named texture used for rendering purposes. The texture data is stored as a binary blob interpreted according to the specified texture format.

properties.description: A human-readable description of the Texture
properties.name: Description

properties.description: Encoded texture data
properties.name: Data

properties.description: Format of the encoded texture data. See the ImageSourceFormat enum in the API.
properties.name: Format

properties.description: Image width in pixels.
properties.label: Width
properties.name: Width

properties.description: Image height in pixels.
properties.label: Height
properties.name: Height

properties.description: Currently unused and always zero.
properties.name: Flags

TypeDefinitionElement.description: Defines a shared set of properties (the 'type') that can be associated with a bis:Element.
TypeDefinitionElement.label: Type Definition

UrlLink.description: A bis:UrlLink is a bis:LinkElement that specifies a URL link.
UrlLink.label: URL Link

properties.description: A URL pointing to an external resource.
properties.label: URL
properties.name: Url

properties.description: A human-readable description of the URL
properties.name: Description

properties.description: The view that is to be attached
properties.name: View

ViewDefinition.description: A bis:ViewDefinition specifies the area/volume that is viewed, and refers to a bis:DisplayStyle and a bis:CategorySelector to be used. Subclasses of bis:ViewDefinition determine which model(s) are viewed.
ViewDefinition.label: View Definition

properties.description: A human-readable description of the View Definition
properties.name: Description

ViewDefinition2d.description: A view of a 2D model that has its own local coordinate system.
ViewDefinition2d.label: 2D View Definition

properties.description: Lower left corner of the viewed area.
properties.name: Origin

properties.description: Size of the view diagonal
properties.name: Extents

properties.description: Rotation angle in degrees of the viewed area.
properties.label: Rotation Angle
properties.name: RotationAngle

ViewDefinition3d.description: A bis:ViewDefinition3d specifies the volume that is viewed on referenced 3D bis:Models. It refers to a bis:DisplayStyle3d and a bis:CategorySelector to be used.
ViewDefinition3d.label: 3D View Definition

properties.description: Origin of the viewed volume on the lower, back, rear
properties.name: Origin

properties.description: Size of the view diagonal
properties.name: Extents

properties.description: Yaw component of the view direction in degrees
properties.name: Yaw

properties.description: Pitch component of the view direction in degrees
properties.name: Pitch

properties.description: Roll component of the view direction in degrees
properties.name: Roll

properties.description: Is the camera actually turned on?
properties.label: Is Camera On
properties.name: IsCameraOn

properties.description: Camera eye point
properties.label: Eye Point
properties.name: EyePoint

properties.description: Camera lens angle in degrees
properties.label: Lens Angle
properties.name: LensAngle

properties.description: Camera focus distance
properties.label: Focus Distance
properties.name: FocusDistance

VolumeElement.description: A bis:VolumeElement is a bis:SpatialLocationElement that is restricted to defining a volume.
VolumeElement.label: Volume Element

customAttributes.Description: Instances of WebMercatorModel are no longer created.

label: BIS Core
name: BisCore
